trial_identification.studytitle: A longitudinal study of caries development in children from 4 to 15 years of age
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised phase III study to determine the longitudinal effects of chlorhexidine toothpaste and Casein Phosphopeptide- Amorphous Calcium Phosphate (CPP-ACP Tooth Mousse) in the treatment of dental caries in children to prevent new lesions

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: This study is a continuation of study "A longitudinal study of caries prevention in children aged two to four years" ACTRN12609000330246 and will be recruiting participants who have already undergone and will continue to undergo two interventions arms. Either brushing teeth with fluoridated toothpaste in combination with CPP-ACP Tooth Mousse or brushing teeth with fluoridated toothpaste in combination with 0.12% chlorhexidine toothpaste from 4 years until 15 years of age.
interventions.comparator: Control group is toothbrushing daily with only fluoridated toothpaste

primaryOutcome.outcome: Less numbers of carious lesions and or demineralised tooth surfaces as detected through visual examination.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 6 monthly starting when a child is 4.5 years of age until they are 15 years of age

primaryOutcome.outcome: Less numbers of teeth with erosion as determined through visual examination.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 6 monthly starting when a child is 4.5 years of age until they are 15 years of age

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Lower levels of decay causing bacteria as detected through Caries Risk Test (CRT) Bacteria Test by Ivoclar.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 6 monthly starting when a child is 4.5 years of age until they are 15 years of age

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All children who complete research study "A longitudinal study of caries prevention in children aged two to four years"
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Children who are diagnosed with milk protein allergies will be removed from the intervention group of Tooth Mousse and continue the project in the Fluoride only group.

trial_design.concealment: Continuation of previously randomised product use as per allocation by opaque envelopes
trial_design.sequence: Continuation of simple randomisation by using procedures such as coin tossing and dice rolling

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Metro South Health Service District, Oral Health Program, Logan Beaudesert Division
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Kingston Oral Health Centre, Juers St Kingston, Qld 4114

fundingsource.fundingname: Metro South Health Service District, Oral Health Program, Logan Beaudesert Division
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Kingston Oral Health Centre, Juers St Kingston, Qld 4114

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
In this study we will continue to follow participants recruited to " A longitudinal study of caries prevention in children aged two to four years" HREC/09/QPAH/158, ACTRN12609000330246 who have undergone preventative methods of education, home visits and toothbrushing with fluoride toothpaste, 0.2% chlorhexideine gel and CPP-ACP Tooth Mousse.
The effectiveness of these strategies will be assessed through -microbial analysis for the presence of decay causing bacteria - clinical dental examination data - statistical analysis of data for case and control groups

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Metro South Health Service District (HSD) Human Research Ethics Committee (HREC)
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Level 2, Building 35, Princess Alexandra Hospital, Ipswich Road, Woolloongabba, QLD 4102
